Tolkien-related events that took place in 1937.

content.title: January
content.content:
3 - Actor Norman Forsey is born.
4 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 9.
7 - At the request of his father, young Rayner Unwin writes a book report on Farmer Giles of Ham. This is the first of many positive critiques.
16 - Artist Klaus Ensikat is born.
17 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 10.

content.title: February
content.content:
4 - J.R.R. Tolkien's poem "The Dragon's Visit" is published in The Oxford Magazine.
5 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 11.
12 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 11a.
18 - J.R.R. Tolkien's poem "Knocking at the Door" is published in The Oxford Magazine.

content.title: March
content.content:
4 - J.R.R. Tolkien's poem "Iúmonna Gold Galdre Bewunden" is republished in the Oxford Magazine.
6 - Michael Deacon, who would voice Gríma Wormtongue in The Lord of the Rings (1978 film), is born.
10 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 11b.

content.title: April
content.content:
? - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 11c.
13 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 12.
15 - Charles Furth writes a letter to J.R.R.Tolkien.
20 - George Takei, who travelled the world as narrator of Johan de Meij's Symphony No. 1, "The Lord of the Rings", is born.
25 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to Charles Furth.

content.title: May
content.content:
13 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 13.
28 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 14.

content.title: June
content.content:
10 - The Battle of Maldon, edited by E.V. Gordon and with contribution by J.R.R. Tolkien, is published.
25 - Author Timothy J. Wheeler is born.

content.title: July
content.content: 1 - Beowulf: The Monsters and the Critics is published.

content.title: August
content.content:
1 - Ian Hogg, who would voice Tom Bombadil in BBC's radio series of Tales from the Perilous Realm, is born.
5 - Alan Howard, the voice for the One Ring in The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring and The Return of the King, is born.
31 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 15.

content.title: September
content.content:
7 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to George Allen & Unwin concerning the promotion of The Hobbit and mentioning his friend Wilfred Rowland Childe.
17 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 15a.
21 - The Hobbit is published.
21 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to Simonne d'Ardenne.
21 – J.R.R. Tolkien signs copies of The Hobbit and sends them to E.V. Gordon, Elaine Griffiths, Helen Buckhurst, Stella Mills, Hilary Tolkien, C.S. Lewis and Katherine Kilbride.
22 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to Jane Neave.
28 - Donald Gee, who would voice Radagast in 1981 radio series, is born.

content.title: October
content.content:
2 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 15b.
2 - C.S. Lewis publishes a review of The Hobbit in The Times Literary Supplement.
3 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 16.
8 - C.S. Lewis reviews The Hobbit in The Times.
9 - Brian Blessed, who would play Farmer Giles in Tales from the Perilous Realm (1992 radio series), is born.
15 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 17.
23 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 18.

content.title: November
content.content:
15 - Tolkien submits to Allen & Unwin a bundle of manuscripts including The Lay of Leithian ("Long Poem"); Quenta Silmarillion, Ainulindalë, Ambarkanta, and The Fall of Númenor (chapter) ("The Gnomes Material"); The Lost Road; and Farmer Giles of Ham and Mr. Bliss. They also discuss Beowulf.
22 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 18a.
28 - G.E. Selby writes a letter to J.R.R.Tolkien.
29 - Jared Lobdell is born.

content.title: December
content.content:
13 - Arthur Ransome writes a letter to J.R.R. Tolkien.
14-15 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to G.E. Selby.
15 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to Arthur Ransome.
15 - Stanley Unwin writes to Tolkien that his "Silmarillion" is not fit for a book by itself, but rather "wonderful material" to inspire more books like The Hobbit.[1]
16-19 - Tolkien starts writing the first chapter of the "New Hobbit", which will later become The Lord of the Rings.
16 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 19.
17 - Charles Furth writes a letter to J.R.R. Tolkien.
19 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to Charles Furth (Letter 20).
25 - Father Christmas writes a letter to J.R.R. Tolkien's children.

? - Tolkien submits The Father Christmas Letters and a draft of The Silmarillion for publication but they are rejected.
? - Author Jared Lobdell is born.

content.content:
